intro: Eryngium larranagae, commonly known as the Larranaga thistle, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant has spiny, gray-green leaves and produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to survive in dry, rocky environments with minimal water. Eryngium larranagae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
